goal.en:
The purposes of Capstone Project I are threefold:
1. To develop the student’s capacity to formulate tractable research questions on
interdisciplinary problems or coherent set of questions that are interdisciplinary in
nature, that is, questions which cannot be addressed optimally within the scope of
a single academic discipline
2. To foster the student’s capacity to choose or develop a research design and
method of investigation that suits the nature of the research question(s)
3. To provide reflective experience in piloting the investigation or project, including
practice in data analysis suitable to the research purposes and to the nature of the
data gathered
4. To cultivate the student’s capacity to evaluate and adjust relevant aspects of the
research process (the research questions, design, data, and data analyses)
according to what is learned from piloting an investigation

flexDiscription.en:
The student will be required to turn in the written assignments and give oral presentations
as indicated in the weekly schedule above. In addition, the student will meet with the
instructor on a regular basis.
